newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan aluminium can recycling rate hits record.
newsitem.headline: Japan aluminium can recycling rate hits record.

text.p: Japan's rate of aluminium can recycling hit a record high of 70.2 percent in the business year ended March 1997, up from 65.7 percent in the previous year, industry data showed on Friday.
The industry body Japan Aluminium Can Recycling estimated that 190,391 tonnes of aluminium cans were recycled in 1996/97, against total sales of 271,298 tonnes for aluminium cans.
The figures showed the rate met the target set by a government advisory panel, which called for increasing Japan's aluminium can recycling rate to 70 percent by 2000.
The increase reflected efforts by local governments to promote recycling.

The so-called can-to-can rate, or the percentage of recycled cans used to make new can stock rather than for die-casting or other purposes, stood at 71.2 percent in 1996/97, up from 45.6 percent in the previous year.
